Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 10:57AM audrianna wrote: Well, for my excisional biopsy, I don't remember a thing.  I felt like I woke up in a dirty bathtub in a seedy hotel in a foreign country missing an organ and not having a clue how I got there! :o) I guess it beats remembering exactly what was happening!  Good luck.  I hope everything works out well for you.
Posts.Title: biopsy Kaijah8 CUGymGirl

Posts.Content: audrianna wrote: And it's benign.  It was just a fibroadenoma. This website has been such a blessing.  I have learned so much from y'all! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The results are in audrianna mdg

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2011 04:28PM audrianna wrote: nekk, I'm glad to read your post.  I have a solid, round, possibly benign lump.  I met with the surgeon today and while he told me he could do a FNA or a core needle biopsy and he would be fine with the results, I told him I just wanted it out.  I have been thinking that it's probably overkill, but I am afraid I would just worry if I didn't do it.  I'm glad things went well for you.  (My dr. wanted me to take off a week, but I told him I couldn't. So he said he would be okay if I just took off three days.)
Posts.Title: Any questions I should be asking about an excisional biopsy? Robynmummy Robynmummy

Posts.Content: audrianna wrote: Well, thanks to y'all -- and good drugs, I survived my excisional biopsy today.  I'm sure I saw my surgeon earlier this morning, but I don't remember a thing!  The one thing I do remember is asking a nurse how long before the pathology reports are in and she said 2-3 weeks.  That sounds like a very long time!  I saw on my discharge papers that my doctor's office will call tomorrow to check in so hopefully I can ask some questions.  (Like did my surgeon actually perform the surgery!   How in the world could I not remember anything about the entire procedure??)  After reading the posts on here, I feel confident that my lump is just a fibroadenoma, but it will be reassuring to see it in print.  Whatever the outcome, I have a whole new perspective on things.  I'm amazed at how brave the people on this site are -- you inspire me!
